metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Styles - CSS
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.
content.html: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

content.text: CSS saves a lot of work. It can control the layout of multiple web pages all at once.
content.html: CSS saves a lot of work. It can control the layout of multiple web pages all at once.

content.text: CSS = Styles and Colors
What is CSS?
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is used to format the layout of a webpage.
content.html: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is used to format the layout of a webpage.

content.text: With CSS, you can control the color, font, the size of text, the spacing between elements, how elements are positioned and laid out, what background images or background colors are to be used, different displays for different devices and screen sizes, and much more!
content.html: With CSS, you can control the color, font, the size of text, the spacing between elements, how elements are positioned and laid out, what background images or background colors are to be used, different displays for different devices and screen sizes, and much more!

content.text: Tip: The word cascading means that a style applied to a parent element will also apply to all children elements within the parent. So, if you set the color of the body text to "blue", all headings, paragraphs, and other text elements within the body will also get the same color (unless you specify something else)!
content.html: Tip: The word cascading means that a style applied to a parent element will also apply to all children elements within the parent. So, if you set the color of the body text to "blue", all headings, paragraphs, and other text elements within the body will also get the same color (unless you specify something else)!

content.text: Using CSS
CSS can be added to HTML documents in 3 ways:
content.html: CSS can be added to HTML documents in 3 ways:

content.text: The most common way to add CSS, is to keep the styles in external CSS files. However, in this tutorial we will use inline and internal styles, because this is easier to demonstrate, and easier for you to try it yourself.
content.html: The most common way to add CSS, is to keep the styles in external CSS files. However, in this tutorial we will use inline and internal styles, because this is easier to demonstrate, and easier for you to try it yourself.

content.text: Inline CSS
An inline CSS is used to apply a unique style to a single HTML element.
content.html: An inline CSS is used to apply a unique style to a single HTML element.

content.text: An inline CSS uses the style attribute of an HTML element.
content.html: An inline CSS uses the style attribute of an HTML element.

content.text:
The following example sets the text color of the

element to blue, and the text color of the

element to red:
content.html: The following example sets the text color of the <h1> element to blue, and the text color of the <p> element to red:

content.code:
A Blue Heading

A red paragraph.
content.code_html:
<h1 style="color:blue;">A Blue Heading</h1>

<p style="color:red;">A red paragraph.</p>

content.text: Internal CSS
An internal CSS is used to define a style for a single HTML page.
content.html: An internal CSS is used to define a style for a single HTML page.

content.text: An internal CSS is defined in the <head> section of an HTML page, within a <style> element.
content.html: An internal CSS is defined in the <head> section of an HTML page, within a <style> element.

content.text:
The following example sets the text color of ALL the

elements (on that page) to blue, and the text color of ALL the

elements to red. In addition, the page will be displayed with a "powderblue" background color:
content.html: The following example sets the text color of ALL the <h1> elements (on that page) to blue, and the text color of ALL the <p> elements to red. In addition, the page will be displayed with a "powderblue" background color:

content.code:
This is a heading

This is a paragraph.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>
body {background-color: powderblue;}
h1   {color: blue;}
p    {color: red;}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>
<p>This is a paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>

content.text: External CSS
An external style sheet is used to define the style for many HTML pages.
content.html: An external style sheet is used to define the style for many HTML pages.

content.text: To use an external style sheet, add a link to it in the <head> section of each HTML page:
content.html: To use an external style sheet, add a link to it in the <head> section of each HTML page:

content.code:
This is a heading

This is a paragraph.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>
<p>This is a paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>

content.text: The external style sheet can be written in any text editor. The file must not contain any HTML code, and must be saved with a .css extension.
content.html: The external style sheet can be written in any text editor. The file must not contain any HTML code, and must be saved with a .css extension.

content.text: Here is what the "styles.css" file looks like:
content.html: Here is what the "styles.css" file looks like:

syntaxHighlighting.text: body {  background-color: powderblue;}h1 {  color: blue;}p {  color: red;}

content.code: body {  background-color: powderblue;}h1 {  color: blue;}p {  color: red;}

syntax_highlighting.text: body {  background-color: powderblue;}h1 {  color: blue;}p {  color: red;}

content.code_html:
body {
  background-color: powderblue;
}
h1 {
  color: blue;
}
p {
  color: red;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: body {  background-color: powderblue;}h1 {  color: blue;}p {  color: red;}

content.text: Tip: With an external style sheet, you can change the look of an entire web site, by changing one file!
content.html: Tip: With an external style sheet, you can change the look of an entire web site, by changing one file!

content.text: CSS Colors, Fonts and Sizes
Here, we will demonstrate some commonly used CSS properties. You will learn more about them later.
content.html: Here, we will demonstrate some commonly used CSS properties. You will learn more about them later.

content.text: The CSS color property defines the text color to be used.
content.html: The CSS color property defines the text color to be used.

content.text: The CSS font-family property defines the font to be used.
content.html: The CSS font-family property defines the font to be used.

content.text: The CSS font-size property defines the text size to be used.
content.html: The CSS font-size property defines the text size to be used.

content.code:
This is a heading

This is a paragraph.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>
h1 {
  color: blue;
  font-family: verdana;
  font-size: 300%;
}
p {
  color: red;
  font-family: courier;
  font-size: 160%;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>
<p>This is a paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>

content.text: CSS Border
The CSS border property defines a border around an HTML element.
content.html: The CSS border property defines a border around an HTML element.

content.text: Tip: You can define a border for nearly all HTML elements.
content.html: Tip: You can define a border for nearly all HTML elements.

content.code_html:
p {
  border: 2px solid powderblue;
}

content.text: CSS Padding
The CSS padding property defines a padding (space) between the text and the border.
content.html: The CSS padding property defines a padding (space) between the text and the border.

content.code_html:
p {
  border: 2px solid powderblue;
  padding: 30px;
}

content.text: CSS Margin
The CSS margin property defines a margin (space) outside the border.
content.html: The CSS margin property defines a margin (space) outside the border.

content.code_html:
p {
  border: 2px solid powderblue;
  margin: 50px;
}

content.text: Link to External CSS
External style sheets can be referenced with a full URL or with a path relative to the current web page.
content.html: External style sheets can be referenced with a full URL or with a path relative to the current web page.

content.code_html: <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/html/styles.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="/html/styles.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">

content.text: You can read more about file paths in the chapter HTML File Paths .
content.html: You can read more about file paths in the chapter HTML File Paths.

content.text: Chapter Summary
Tip: You can learn much more about CSS in our CSS Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: You can learn much more about CSS in our CSS Tutorial.

content.html: What is a correct syntax for linking to an external stylesheet?

content.text: HTML Style Tags

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<style> Defines style information for an HTML document
<link> Defines a link between a document and an external resource

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
